item.title: ARC Raiders Roadmap, Explained‚ÄîAll Future ARC Raiders Plans
item.content:encoded:
New extraction shooter ARC Raiders is looking to ‚ÄòEmbark‚Äô on a long journey. Whether it has the legs remains to be seen, but we‚Äôve extracted some new information about the shooter and the potential ARC Raiders roadmap of future content.

ARC Raiders is one of the big, new multiplayer dogs in 2025. With Call of Duty unable to crack the DMZ nut, Escape From Tarkov has largely had the genre to itself. Say hello to Embark Studios‚Äô ARC Raiders!

The extraction shooter has had multiple betas‚Äîincluding the late-on Server Slam playtest‚Äîand it‚Äôs time to look forward instead of back.

Does ARC Raiders Have A Roadmap?

No, ARC Raiders doesn‚Äôt officially have a roadmap yet, as Embark Studios is unwilling to commit to additional content plans for the time being.

However, it doesn‚Äôt mean the developer isn‚Äôt thinking about the future, and this is evident with he shocking reveal that the ARC Raiders devs are already planning 10 years worth of content.

Embark Studios design lead Virgil Watkins said: ‚ÄúI think internally, for a very long time, we referred to this [ARC Raiders] as a 10-year game. That is the ambition we are aiming for and that dictates the type and quantity of content we want to put into it.‚Äù

We often see multiplayer games and single-player games with season passes announce future content before the current chunk of gameplay is out! ARC Raiders isn‚Äôt going down this path anytime soon, as these plans can ‚ÄúSpiral into promises that can go unfulfilled if things change.‚Äù

What New Content Is Coming To ARC Raiders?

Virgil Watkins has stated that ARC Raiders is likely to add fresh maps, more quests, and additional common-sense content throughout the game‚Äôs lifespan.

Here‚Äôs the design lead‚Äôs words in full: ‚ÄúOf course, adding things over time like new maps, extending questlines, and introducing new enemies and new weapons, and things like that. We‚Äôll have some stuff lined up post-launch and for a little bit after, but then it will be based on what we see out of the launch and thereafter.‚Äù

It sounds like the typical content you‚Äôd come to expect from a post-game launch for an extraction shooter. We respect the fact that the team doesn‚Äôt want to put a timeframe on the new content and see how the launch plays out first.

Based on your time in any of the game‚Äôs playtests, what do you think ARC Raiders is lacking? It‚Äôs time to let us know via the Insider Gaming Discord server and the comments section below.

We have much more ARC Raiders content, including its price and whether it‚Äôs free to play, if there‚Äôs Launch Early Access, and ARC Raiders has optional progression wipes.

item.title: Legendary GTA Competitor ‚ÄòScarface‚Äô Coming to Steam and Epic with HD Graphics Mode
item.content:encoded:
In recent hours, eagle-eyed gamers have scoured repositories on Steam and Epic Games on PC to find out everything they can about a reappearance of 2006‚Äôs Scarface: The World is Yours. The open-world title emerged as a competitor to Grand Theft Auto on the PlayStation 2, but due to complex licensing issues, it was never revisited.

It now appears to be being brought back to life by a new publisher, and it is being given a new face with an HD graphics mode added as a DLC. In case you‚Äôre unfamiliar, The World is Yours puts players in the shoes of Tony Montana from the 1983 Scarface movie, presenting an alternate universe in which he survives an assassination attempt and must rebuild his drug empire.

Is Scarface: The World is Yours Coming Back?

Scarface: The World is Yours has always been one of those games that fans have desperately sought a remaster of. It was released in 2006 and offered a large open-world map of Miami, customization options, the ability to rebuild and decorate Tony Montana‚Äôs iconic mansion, and the gameplay loop facilitated the construction of an empire.

It was buggy as hell in many ways, and the PC port that was released way back when was a shambles, but on PlayStation 2, the game was a certified banger that still sits firmly in my mind twenty years later. It was originally pieced together by Radical Entertainment, the same studio that made The Simpsons Hit & Run and the Prototype games.

Scarface: The World is Yours was a heavily licensed game that featured Al Pacino‚Äôs likeness as Tony Montana, dialogue, direct-to-game story elements, a top soundtrack, and branding. This long presented a licensing concern when the discussion came about remastering or re-releasing the game.

Now, Hong Kong-based publisher EC Digital Entertainment appears to be floating the game on digital platforms for the first time. The unheard-of publisher seems to be backing a re-release of Scarface: The World is Yours on the Epic Store and on Valve‚Äôs Steam storefront, but no release date has been given.

It has been suggested by some users on social media that the Epic Games store, especially, has been ‚Äòreleased early‚Äô in what looks like some twisted backend glitch.

Scarface: The World is Yours is a game that all Grand Theft Auto fans should check out. It might have twenty years on it by now, but it‚Äôs a phenomenal title that was overshadowed by the earlier launch of GTA: San Andreas in late 2004 and the later launch of GTA: IV in 2008.

Let me know on the Insider Gaming Discord server if you‚Äôre hoping for a resurgence of Scarface: The World is Yours.

item.title: Persona 3 Reload Bringing Back Original Singer for New Update
item.content:encoded:
Persona 3 Reload is bringing back the original‚Äôs singer with a new update celebrating the Nintendo Switch 2 release.

Released in 2024, Persona 3 Reload served as the series‚Äô first remake, bringing the 2006 original back to life for newer generations. With the changes, the original vocalist, Yumi Kawamura, did not return. Instead, the music was sung by Azumi Takahashi, as well as returning contributor Lotus Juice. Upon its release, it received tons of praise for its reinvention of the game and dedication to the original. An expansion, titled Project Aigis, came out later that year and acted as an epilogue to the game‚Äôs narrative. A port of Persona 3 Reload is launching on Nintendo Switch 2 on October 23rd and, as celebration, a nostalgic voice is making her return.

Yumi Kawamura‚Äôs Original Persona 3 Songs Returning for Persona 3 Reload in Upcoming Update

In a post on Twitter/X, Atlus West revealed that songs from the original Persona 3 and FES will be coming to Reload on October 23rd, when the Nintendo Switch 2 version is released. To celebrate the occasion, vocalist Yumi Kawamura, who performed the songs for the 2006 JRPG, spoke about the addition. In a statement below, she says

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs been a while!‚Äù Kawamura states. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm truly overjoyed and grateful to be reunited with everyone again. Persona 3 is a treasure to me as well‚ÄîI can‚Äôt help but feel excited. Old friends, will you fight alongside me once more? New friends, how about letting my songs aid you in battle? Let‚Äôs celebrate together. Thank you for your continued support!‚Äù

The songs being added to Persona 3 Reload from Persona 3 and FES are as follows:

  • ‚ÄúBurn My Dread -Last Battle-‚Äú
  • ‚ÄúMass Destruction‚Äù
  • ‚ÄúDeep Mentality‚Äù
  • ‚ÄúWhen The Moon‚Äôs Reaching Out Stars‚Äù
  • ‚ÄúWant to Be Close‚Äù
  • ‚ÄúMemories of You‚Äù
  • ‚ÄúMass Destruction -P3fes Version-‚Äú
  • ‚ÄúBrand New Days‚Äù

It‚Äôs important to note that the songs will only be available during exploration in Tartarus and in battles. The songs, as mentioned before, will come to Persona 3 Reload on October 23rd via a new patch. Luckily, all consoles, like PlayStation 5 and Xbox Series X|S will get to listen to Yumi‚Äôs iconic tracks then, too. While Azumi‚Äôs versions of Persona 3‚Äôs songs were great, Yumi‚Äôs rasp and range can‚Äôt be beat. As a fan of the series, it‚Äôs good to see her renditions return and add some nostalgia to the amazing turn-based gameplay.

item.title: Luigi‚Äôs Mansion Coming to Nintendo Switch Online This Halloween
item.content:encoded:
Luigi‚Äôs Mansion is coming to Nintendo Switch 2 via Nintendo Switch Online just in time for Halloween.

As a benefit of Nintendo Switch Online, many nostalgic games from Nintendo‚Äôs past are available to play. From NES classics like Donkey Kong to Game Boy hits like Tetris, there‚Äôs a lot to enjoy for fans. With the newly released Nintendo Switch 2, an Expansion Pack including GameCube, Nintendo 64, and Game Boy Advance titles was released. As the catalog grows, with recent additions including Forsaken 64 and Chibi-Robo, a spooky hit from the 2000s is coming just in time for Halloween.

Nintendo Switch Online Adding Luigi‚Äôs Mansion, Releasing October 30th

In a new video from Nintendo, the company announced that Luigi‚Äôs Mansion is headed to Nintendo Switch Online Expansion Pack. Furthermore, you won‚Äôt have to wait long to play it, as it releases on October 30th, 2025, the day before Halloween. The iconic 2001 title, released on the Nintendo GameCube, has since gone on to have a 3DS re-release and two other mainline entries. Luigi‚Äôs Mansion follows Mario‚Äôs brother, Luigi, as he navigates a ghost-infested mansion in search of his brother and friends. With a handy Poltergust 3000 and the kooky Prof. E. Gadd, you‚Äôll take down the many ghosts and specters you‚Äôll encounter.

The most recent title from the Luigi‚Äôs Mansion series was a re-release of Luigi‚Äôs Mansion 2 HD for the Nintendo Switch in 2024. As for the last mainline entry, that was Luigi‚Äôs Mansion 3 in 2019, also for the Nintendo Switch. Its success as a Mario spinoff has made it a household name and one many hope makes a return with a new game. Perhaps the addition to Nintendo Switch Online could be a sign it‚Äôs in the works or if interest is there? In any case, Luigi‚Äôs Mansion‚Äôs addition is a scare we all can enjoy.

item.title: Splinter Cell Remake Loses Another Director
item.content:encoded:
According to a new job listing from Ubisoft, the Splinter Cell remake has lost its director again.

Based on the Tom Clancy brand, Splinter Cell brings the stealth espionage action to gaming. With six mainline titles and a dozen novelizations, the series was a hit in the 2000s/2010s. Unfortunately, we last played as Sam Fisher back in 2013 with the cool yet controversial Blacklist. Having been over a decade since the last entry, a remake of the franchise‚Äôs first title was in order and announced in 2021. Sadly, all the news surrounding the project since hasn‚Äôt been the best, with no updates and the original director leaving. Now, it seems whoever came after them has quit the remake, according to a new Ubisoft job listing.

Ubisoft Hiring New Director for Splinter Cell Remake

According to Tech4Gamers, a job listing, which has since been taken down, was available on Ubisoft‚Äôs website. The position, Game Director, was for the Ubisoft Toronto office and would be for the Splinter Cell remake. The description for the job states that the person would be part of the Splinter Cell development team, leading workers and coming up with new features.

In 2022, the original director, David Grivel, left the project and Ubisoft after more than a decade at the company. Given we haven‚Äôt seen any gameplay or updates like The Prince of Persia: Sands of Time Remake, things look a bit unsteady. Just recently, the series did get a small revival with Netflix‚Äôs Splinter Cell: Deathwatch, an animated series from John Wick creator Derek Kolstad. The show was renewed for a second season shortly after premiering, so it seems the hype for a new entry is very much present. Hopefully, things will work out and we‚Äôll finally put on those night-vision goggles again.
